description: Close to many colleges and universities in and around the City. It is known for its huge student population.

Locals call Jamaica Plain: JP. The classic streetcar suburb that has become one of the most dynamic neighborhoods in Boston. Surrounded by the Emerald Necklace/ Arnold Arboretum/ Franklin Park and Jamaica Pond.
Has all the amenities of the City in a suburban environment. The neighborhood was annexed into the City in 1912. The Neponset River runs through its center.
Was once home to an experimental utopian community. Famous writers like Ralph Waldo Emerson/ Nathaniel Hawthorne/ Henry David Thoreau visited the area.
One of the most appealing neighborhoods in America. Unique shops/trendy restaurants and vintage homes are found on its main streets.
Home to the Massachusetts State House and many historical landmarks. Architecture and layout reflect old colonial Boston. Brick row houses feature ornate doors and decorative iron work.
The largest neighborhood in Boston is also one of the most diverse. Long-time residents mingle together with new immigrants from many countries.
